raw_infobox.name: Larry Bird
raw_infobox.caption: Bird in 2004
raw_infobox.high_school: Springs Valley High School(French Lick, Indiana)
raw_infobox.highlights:
;As player:
* 3× NBA champion (1981, 1984, 1986)
* 2× Bill Russell NBA Finals Most Valuable Player Award (1984, 1986)
* 3× NBA Most Valuable Player Award (1983–1985)
* 12× NBA All-Star (1980–1988, 1990–1992)
* NBA All-Star Game Most Valuable Player Award (1982)
* 9× All-NBA First Team (1979–1987)
* All-NBA Second Team (1989)
* 3× NBA All-Defensive Second Team (1981–1983)
* NBA Rookie of the Year Award (1979)
* NBA All-Rookie Team (1979)
* 3× NBA Three-Point Contest champion (1986–1988)
* Associated Press Athlete of the Year (1986)
* NBA anniversary team (50 Greatest Players in NBA History, NBA 75th Anniversary Team)
* {{abbr|No.|Number}} 33 List of Boston Celtics accomplishments and records#Retired numbers
* Consensus List of U.S. men's college basketball national player of the year awards (1978–79 NCAA Division I men's basketball season)
* 2× Consensus first-team NCAA Men's Basketball All-Americans (1978 NCAA Men's Basketball All-Americans, 1979 NCAA Men's Basketball All-Americans)
* Third-team All-American – National Association of Basketball Coaches, United Press International (1977 NCAA Men's Basketball All-Americans)
* 2× Missouri Valley Conference Men's Basketball Player of the Year (1978, 1979)
* 2× First-team All-Missouri Valley Conference (1978, 1979)
* No. 33 Indiana State Sycamores men's basketball#Retired numbers
;As coach:
* NBA Coach of the year Award (1997)
* NBA All-Star Game head coach (1998 NBA All-Star Game)
;As executive:
* NBA Executive of the Year Award (2011)

personal_info.high_school: Springs Valley High School(French Lick, Indiana)
